Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; interior reserved; exterior, white slip: tongue frieze, mostly black, two (and part of third) painted in added red at top of sholuder with black line below; on shoulder, elaborate floral pattern consisting of black petals (with added red) with single leaf between, and part of tendril; pinwheel rosette, dots and dashes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels regarding the decorative pattern, see British Museum 1886,0401.1090 and Copenhagen 5607 in Cook and Dupont, 1998, p. 55, fig. 8.20. See also Rhodes 11544 in CVA, Rodi, Museo Archeologico Dello Spedale Dei Cavalieri 2, II.D.H.1, Pl.(475) 7.1
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.044)
